title: Heptakill?!
body: Umm....Are heptakills possible to get???! Because i got one in one of my games...{{champion:429}}

replies.body: In Bots, a zed got a pentakill, and then got a triple, and the match history said an 8 multikill once... Octakill?

If you are talking about the "Double, triple, quadra, penta" kills, then no you can't. It goes to penta and then resets. If you are playing Hexakill then it is possible to get a hexakill but that is also the highest.

> [{quoted}](name=DiamondAries,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=cV1NeAas,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-06-11T03:22:15.079+0000)
>
> If you are talking about the "Double, triple, quadra, penta" kills, then no you can't. It goes to penta and then resets. If you are playing Hexakill then it is possible to get a hexakill but that is also the highest.

No it doesn't, it just says Legendary kill, but on fansites it keeps going up.

Double, Triple, Quadra, Penta, Legendary, Legendary etc.

Learn something.

It doesn't say "Legendary kill", it just says you are legendary, which is referring to your kill streak and not your rapid kills. To be completely honest, I have never gotten more than 6 rapid kills in a bots game so I don't know if it will keep on saying you are legendary or if it goes through the "double/triple/quadra/penta" again. I do know for certain that the announcer doesn't go past Pentakill (or Hexakill if you are playing that game mode)
Yeah, possible in bot games as your streak will continue as they respawn, you can go up to ten, my highest was eleven.

If it's earlyish game and u wait a bit, then kill one, then wait a bit, then kill one but keep it within streak it's possible to basically get a 10 kill streak because of short respawn timers if it happens during siege and then u are near their spawn.
hmm, I'd like to test this out
Actually it wasn't photoshopped,this is my irl friend

Also this: "The heptagon is also occasionally referred to as the septagon, using "sept-" (an elision of septua-, a Latin-derived numerical prefix, rather than hepta-, a Greek-derived numerical prefix) together with the Greek suffix "-agon" meaning angle)". So yeah it would be Hepta (Penta(gon) Hexa(gon) you dont see any sexakills
Give them the link of the game instead
